data.description:
Go for a Space Walk and feel the vastness of space. Three adventure levels:

The Earth:
Exit the space shuttle and orbit over any part of The Earth to view the continents and oceans. Set the time-of-day to view sunrises and night lights. Complete the challenge to recover satellites to the space shuttle.

Save The World!
An asteroid is heading towards Earth. Navigate through the asteroid's tunnels to plant explosives to destroy it in a race against time. 3 different tunnel maps in free version, 15 when unlocked.

The Space Station.
Fly around the outside of the Space Station and complete the puzzles to fix the solar panels. View fully working Canadarm remote arm and visiting HTV supply vessels. Bonus level for the upgraded version only.

changelog.change_log:
Added fully working CanadaArm to ISS level
Added visiting HTV supply vessels to ISS level
Improved performance in Asteroid and ISS levels
Fixed small bug with the thrust sound effect if thrusting using the trigger button.
Fixed minor bug with back button in Asteroid level

5th June 2020:
Added leader boards to the 15 Asteroid map levels
Added player Achievements to collect

Latest Update:
Improvements to control. Now uses Trigger and Back buttons better.
Some small interface improvements.

Previous Update:
Major update.

New "Save The World" level. Plant explosives deep inside asteroid heading towards earth to save the planet. 3 tunnel mazes in free version, 15 in upgraded version.

New International Space Station level. Explore and fix solar panels with cog puzzle. (Upgraded version only - bonus level)

Updated renderer and imaging for the Earth level. Float around and explore the Earth at any time of day or night.

Major update.

New "Save The World" level. Plant explosives deep inside asteroid heading towards earth to save the planet. 3 tunnel mazes in free version, 15 in upgraded version.

New International Space Station level. Explore and fix solar panels with cog puzzle. (Upgraded version only - bonus level)

Updated renderer and imaging for the Earth level. Float around and explore the Earth at any time of day or night.
New renderer to fix occasional black right eye on some systems.

New control panel options to:
* Randomize the cloud pattern, to reveal different parts of the Earth's surface
* Switch on / off the clouds
* Enable / Disable and change the transition speed when adjusting the orbit viewpoint.

Also some improvements to the interface to work better with the laser pointer.

Improved Earth textures, moving clouds and lighting
New astronaut model
Improved detail in Earth surface, clouds and atmosphere.

* Improved Earth clouds and textures.
* Added music for the ultimate chill-out journey. Watch the world go by.
* Added a new challenge: Fix the solar panels on the ISS.
* Added support for the touchpad on the GearVR unit.

This is an identical build to the last one submitted, but with the minimum supported Android level reduced to 5.0 from 7.0. The previous submitted build passed all tests except a query about support for Lollipop and Marshmallow. I am concerned that older hardware might not reach the desired frame rate, however I submit this version to test out. If it fails, is it acceptable to Oculus to restore the minimum Android level to 7.0 and therefore choose not to support Lollipop and Marshmallow?
